definitions.text: someone to whom private matters are confided

examples: I insinuated that I did not like his wife
The evidence suggests a need for more clarification

definitions.text: marked by close acquaintance, association, or familiarity; ;  - V.L. Parrington
examples: intimate relations between economics, politics, and legal principles

definitions.text: having or fostering a warm or friendly and informal atmosphere
examples: the small room was cozy and intimate

definitions.text: having mutual interests or affections; of established friendship
examples: pretending she is on an intimate footing with those she slanders
the intimate (or sexual) relations between husband and wife
she had been intimate with many men
the internal contradictions of the theory

definitions.text: thoroughly acquainted through study or experience; -W.H.Hudson; - Herbert Read
examples: this girl, so intimate with nature
knowledgeable about the technique of painting
